text: I noticed that sizeof(x) when x is a symbol just returns the number of characters in it

elements.text: I noticed that sizeof(x) when x is a symbol just returns the number of characters in it

text: Seems correct, that's the size of the symbol, right?

elements.text: Seems correct, that's the size of the symbol, right?

text: What’s the “canonical binary representation” of a symbol?  Sure, they’re hashcons’ed in the runtime implementation, but I’m pretty sure serializing them just writes their name out.

elements.text: What’s the “canonical binary representation” of a symbol?  Sure, they’re hashcons’ed in the runtime implementation, but I’m pretty sure serializing them just writes their name out.

text: Knowing how they behave in an array is also useful. As is knowing how Union{Symbol,Nothing} behaves, etc etc
